data.title: Central Maryland Area Command
data.meta_description: VOLUNTEER at The Salvation Army Central Maryland Area Command. We are a nonprofit organization that works to alleviate human suffering and distress without discrimination.
data.text:
Pantry-On-The-Go

During the warmer months, The Salvation partners with the local food bank to host food giveaways or “Pantry-on-the-Go”, which is a large food distribution event hosted at various sites to provide immediate supplementary food assistance throughout the community, and our volunteers are the backbone of this event!

Dates and volunteer times

1400 Fuselage Ave, Middle River, MD 21220 - 9:00 am

Dates: January 19th, March 16th, April 20th, May 18th, June 15th, July 20th, August 17th, September 21st, October 19th

511 Crain Hwy South, Glen Burnie, MD, 21061 - 9:00 am

Dates: March 22nd, April 26th, May 24th, June 28th, July 26th, August 23rd, September 27th, October 25th, November 22nd

300 Seneca Ave, Havre De Grace, MD 21078 - 12:00 pm – 3:00 pm

Dates: March 28th, April 25th, May 23rd, June 27th, July 25th, August 22nd, September 26th, October 24th, November 28th

3267 Pine Orchard Lane, Ellicott City, MD 21042 - 12:00 pm – 2:00 pm

Dates: April 17th, May 15th, June 19th, July 17th, August 21st, September 18th, October 16th

300 Hahn Road, Westminster, MD 21157 - 10:00 am - 12:00 pm

Dates: February 15th, March 15th, April 19th, May 17th, June 21st, July 19th, August 16th, September 6th, October 18th, November 1st.

Bell Ringers

Spread joy and make a difference in your community by volunteering to ring the bell this holiday season to help benefit The Salvation Army of Glen Burnie. As the need for assistance grows, your support is crucial in helping us raise funds to support those in need.

Join us in this heartwarming tradition and be part of something truly special. Your time and dedication can brighten the lives of those facing challenges during this festive time.

To volunteer, please contact Dean Mears at [email protected] or call 410-768-3407. Together, we can make this holiday season a little brighter for everyone in Glen Burnie.

Feeding Kitchen

Our Glen Burnie Service Center needs a volunteer who can assist with our feeding kitchen a few times a week and be able to speak Spanish to further assist our Spanish-speaking clients.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please contact Dean Mears, The Glen Burnie Service Center Director at: [email protected]

The Commodity Supplemental Food Program (CSFP)

CFSP aims to improve the health and wellness of low-income residents, who are 60 years of age and above, by supplementing their diets with nutritious vegetables, fruits, grains, and meats from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA). Our seniors who are running on a tight income, less family support, and nutrition issues need your help. Help fight food scarcity today by packing a box full of hope.

You can help pack food boxes that will be delivered to Baltimore City/County senior citizens every:

Saturday from 9:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m.

We can accommodate groups on other dates

Even if you can only come in for just an hour or for the entire duration, you pick what time works for you. Every minute helps our seniors get closer to a well-balanced meal.

Our warehouse is located at 400 East 29th St, Baltimore MD 21218. We provide volunteers with a free, ample, parking lot; a facility that is handicap accessible, and opportunities to make lifelong friends.

If you have any questions or accommodation help please contact Samantha Bowman

Volunteers interested in volunteering for our CSFP program must e-mail our Volunteer Coordinator Samantha Bowman at [email protected]
